intro: Phyllobolus latipetalus, commonly known as the broad-petaled phyllobolus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad petals that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This species is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments.
